definition: to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion

sentences.english: Virtue may not always make a face handsome, but vice will certainly make it ugly.
sentences.chinese: 美德不一定能使容貌變美，邪念卻必然令人變醜。

sentences.english: Never laughing can help keep your appearance from wrinkling and getting uglier .
sentences.chinese: 永遠不笑可以幫助保持容顏，阻止皺紋的產生和變醜。

sentences.english: The injury disfigured the boss's face.
sentences.chinese: 老闆的臉因受傷而變醜了。

sentences.english: Because I adhere to the perfect note, do not want a laissez-faire ugly feet.
sentences.chinese: 因爲我恪守着完美注意，不願意放任雙足變醜。

definition: dispirited and downcast (idiom); listless/in low spirits/washed out
see the opportunity and act (idiom); to act according to circumstances/to play it by ear/to use one's discretion
the rice is cooked/what's done is done/it's too late to change anything now (idiom)
pinyin: sheng1 mi3 zhu3 cheng2 shu2 fan4

definition: to puff up/to swell up/to inflate/to blow air into sth/(fig.) to encourage/to support
(of fruit etc) fresh/(of a person etc) full of life/healthy-looking/(of eyes) moist and bright/lustrous
bearer of ill luck/person with the evil eye/comet
